Tucson puts a gentile arm around Talon's shoulders and looks up into the br=
anches of the tree, but finds himself bonked on the head by a tree nut, whi=
ch is dropped by a rodent.  He chuckles and gives the nut back to the roden=
t.

" You dropped this."

The rodent takes the nut back and vanishes into t=
he tree to eat its prize.  Tucson was one with the creatures and it was obv=
ious that they were comfortable around him.  

" Talon, I'm going to miss t=
his planet just as much as you are, when we leave for Cybertron.  It's just=
 not going to feel like home the way this planet does.  But Leo is right, w=
e can not remain here and upset the balance of time.  But while we're still=
 here, let's enjoy the moment and continue to explore this part of the fore=
st."

Local artist who specializes in illustration, using traditional and d=
igital media.  

I also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great for any occa=
sion!  

Need a great gift idea that is original?  No problem!  Email me at=
 this address and we will talk.

m ripples over glistening river rocks while dragonflies dodge the current o=
f the water. And now, for the first time, Tucson could actually enjoy it vi=
sually as well as harmonically. 
> >

 but I wanted to return here when it was possible for both of us to enjoy i=
t together. And now, we can. I can see why Leo is concerned, so much innoce=

self. And who better to enjoy this treasure than with you? No one. I only h=
ope that after we leave, this world will remain as pure as it is now. But t=
here's more that I want to show you."
> >

 of giant trees and points upward.

d look straight up, it appears to be reaching to the sky, yet it shades you=

so in an innocent manner. It's something Master Yoketron taught me, when he=
 was my Sensai. See things with a different perspective and not always what=
 everyone else sees. Here, I'll show you. "
> >

ulder beneath a large hardwood tree and sits right under it,looking up.
